definition: (coll.) profit-motivated article cynically disguised as feel-good content 雞湯|鸡汤[ji1 tang1] and designed to go viral
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
chicken stock/chicken soup/(fig.) chicken soup for the soul – i.e. feel-good motivational stories (often used disparagingly because the stories don't really effect change in people's lives)
lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
to take care/to be mindful/(Internet slang) to be moved by sth/poignant/to have deep feelings for sb/to lose one's heart to sb
quotation (from a book or existing source)
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
